dialogues.text: Hey, Thompson! Wendell! Get a job! They laugh, flip him off. Brad is back in his element at last. He moves into the main dancing area, works his way across the room, past the bleachers, when he hears a voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hamilton! Brad turns around, seen Spicoli sitting on the bottom rung of the bleachers. Spicoli looks back with true respect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awesome. He throws Brad his annual. Brad gives him his. They sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later.

dialogues.speaker: THE BLEACHERS
dialogues.text: where several couples are passionately making out. Four teachers clomp up into the stands from different angles. They pin the couples in flashlight beams, like the main tower pinning an escaping prisoner.

dialogues.speaker: THE T-BIRDS
dialogues.text: onstage, singing the Rolling Stones' "I'm Free".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Jeff Spicoli leave the dance and come backing down the stairs with a stoner bud. His fist is in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summer, mon! We're there! He turns to his stoner bud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's roll, my man. Spicoli backs right into a young buzz-cut kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, bud! Watch yourselff Spicoli turns around to see he's backed into a squad of eight Lincoln Surf Nazis. They are all standing on the steps, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you Jeff Spicoli? Spicoli looks up and down the row of Surf Nazis. On the end, he sees L.C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him! He did it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, mon, I don't know what your trip is, but... Spicoli dashes off down Luna Street. L.C. and the Surf Nazis take out in hot pursuit, chasing him through the parking lot, past Ridgemont High, and into the night. They will never catch him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: School is out and it's summer business as usual at the Ridgemont Mall. We see the same stores, the same packs of kids roaming the three tiers.

dialogues.speaker: MARK RATNER
dialogues.text: who stands against the railing in his Cinema Four jacket, gazing across the mall at Swenson's Ice Cream Parlor. He sees Stacy walk two girlfriends to the outdoor front tables, and almost look his way. The Rat turns away suddenly. Then he hears her calling out after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Mark! Turn around! Ratner turns around, affects total and complete cool. He waves across the mall to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come over here! He looks back at his post at the theatre, decides it's okay to step away. He walks across the mall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stacy is standing by the sundae bar. Next to her are two empty stools. After a moment, we see The Rat plop onto one of the metal stools. He pounds the seat next to him with the palm of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You. Sit. Stacy turns to look at him, smiles. She sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Stacy. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine. Mark, I'm so glad you came over here because I want you to know something. I just thought I would tell you that I really enjoyed getting to know you this year. The Rat maintains The Attitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? About fifty people I didn't know wrote that in my annual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know everybody says it, but I really mean it. The Rat looks at her from the corner of his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I want you to have this picture, so you won't forget what I look like. And so you'll remember to call me over the summer. She withdraws a picture from her pocket, hands it to The Rat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know, I may be doing some traveling this summer. I don't know how much I'll be around...  (breaks down, takes picture) But I'll give you a call sometime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like that. She gives him a kiss on the mouth, gets up and walks away. The Rat sits there, smiling at the way things sometimes turn out. He slips the picture into his pocket, a satisfied young man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Rat is joined by Mike Damone, who has changed into his street clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wants it, Rat. The Rat snickers, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you. You had pure Attitude. The Rat turns to look at his friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Attitude, Damone, is only good until you meet the right girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you say, Rat. They take off together, blending into the crowd of kids walking the mall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And... you can only tell it's the right girl if you're sensitive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sensitive -- what is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sensitive is when you can tell how people feel without asking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what makes you so sensitive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, for one, I read. I don't watch as much television as you. I'm trying to feel things more. I'm learning a lot about people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you read? What's the last book you read?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lust For Life. It's the story of Vincent Van Gough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scoffs) Yeah, well, I saw the movie. That must mean I'm sensitive too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a way, Damone. It's a vibe. I put it out, and I have personally found that girls do respond. Damone laughs, shoves him hard. We lose sight of the two boys in the sea of kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of Ridgemont Center Mall with music.
